# Archaic Torso of Apollo
Rainer Maria Rilke

_Beginning_
{{1::We cannot know his legendary head}}

# Archaic Torso of Apollo
Rainer Maria Rilke
_Beginning_
We cannot know his legendary head
{{1::with eyes like ripening fruit. And yet his torso}}

# Archaic Torso of Apollo
Rainer Maria Rilke
We cannot know his legendary head
with eyes like ripening fruit. And yet his torso
{{1::is still suffused with brilliance from inside,}}

# Archaic Torso of Apollo
Rainer Maria Rilke
with eyes like ripening fruit. And yet his torso

{{1::like a lamp, in which his gaze, now turned to low,}}

# Archaic Torso of Apollo
Rainer Maria Rilke
is still suffused with brilliance from inside,
like a lamp, in which his gaze, now turned to low,
{{1::gleams in all its power. Otherwise}}

# Archaic Torso of Apollo
Rainer Maria Rilke
like a lamp, in which his gaze, now turned to low,
gleams in all its power. Otherwise
{{1::the curved breast could not dazzle you so, nor could}}

# Archaic Torso of Apollo

gleams in all its power. Otherwise

# Archaic Torso of Apollo

the curved breast could not dazzle you so, nor could

{{1::to that dark center where procreation flared.}}

Rainer Maria Rilke
a smile run through the placid hips and thighs
to that dark center where procreation flared.
{{1::Otherwise this stone would seem defaced}}

# Archaic Torso of Apollo
Rainer Maria Rilke
to that dark center where procreation flared.
Otherwise this stone would seem defaced
{{1::beneath the translucent cascade of the shoulders}}

# Archaic Torso of Apollo
Rainer Maria Rilke
Otherwise this stone would seem defaced
beneath the translucent cascade of the shoulders
{{1::and would not glisten like a wild beast's fur:}}

# Archaic Torso of Apollo
Rainer Maria Rilke
beneath the translucent cascade of the shoulders
and would not glisten like a wild beast's fur:
{{1::would not, from all the borders of itself,}}

# Archaic Torso of Apollo
Rainer Maria Rilke
and would not glisten like a wild beast's fur:
would not, from all the borders of itself,
{{1::burst like a star: for here there is no place}}

# Archaic Torso of Apollo
Rainer Maria Rilke
would not, from all the borders of itself,
burst like a star: for here there is no place
{{1::that does not see you. You must change your life.}}
